metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19956 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
xmlParseBalancedChunkMemoryRecover in parser.c in libxml2 before 2.9.10 has a memory leak related to newDoc->oldNs.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19956` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxml2 - 2.9.4+dfsg1-6.1ubuntu1.3
libxml2-utils - 2.9.4+dfsg1-6.1ubuntu1.3
python-libxml2 - 2.9.4+dfsg1-6.1ubuntu1.3
python3-libxml2 - 2.9.4+dfsg1-6.1ubuntu1.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: ccdm94> the fix for this issue, made available with commit 5a02583c, was reverted in version 2.9.11 with commit a0a8059b, since it seems like the fix introduced various memory issues in libxml2. More information regarding this choice made by upstream can be seen at: https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/libxml2/-/issues/161

criterions.comment: libxml2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.9.4+dfsg1-6.1ubuntu1.3').
